arena.core

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • arena.core.GameState

  • public final class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameState class represents a snapshot of the environment at a specific round. It contains crucial information about everything going on in the world at that point, including: position of players, storm size, and access to the entire map for processing.
    Author:
    ERAU AI Club

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GameState.EntityType
      The EntityType enum represents a set of possible types an entity in the environment may be.

    • Method Detail

      • isOutOfBounds

        public final boolean isOutOfBounds(int x,
                                   int y)
        Returns true if the tile at the specified position is out of the map bounds.

        The position is zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (getMapWidth()-1, getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        x - - a zero-based x-position
        y - - a zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        true if the specified position is out of bounds, false otherwise.

      • getEntityAt

        public final GameState.EntityType getEntityAt(int x,
                                              int y)
                                       throws OutOfBoundsException
        Returns the entity type at the specified position. The position is zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (getMapWidth()-1, getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Returns GameState.EntityType.Empty if the coordinate has no entity at the specified coordinate. Otherwise, returns the respective entity as defined by the set of values in GameState.EntityType.

        Parameters:
        x - - a zero-based x-position
        y - - a zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        the entity at the specified position
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when the position is out of bounds

      • getMapWidth

        public final int getMapWidth()
        Returns the width of the map. This represents the number of columns in the world.
        Returns:
        width of the map

      • getMapHeight

        public final int getMapHeight()
        Returns the height of the map. This represents the number of rows in the world.
        Returns:
        height of the map

      • getMap

        public final GameState.EntityType[][] getMap()
        Returns a 2-dimensional array of the map populated with GameState.EntityType for each position, where the 2D index is the position. This contains all entities in the map at this point in time. The size of the array is getMapWidth() by getMapHeight().

        For example, to get which entity is at coordinate (3, 4), one would do: 

         EntityType[][] map = gameState.getMap();
 EntityType entity = map[3][4];
        Returns:
        a 2D map of the entities

      • getOpponentHealth

        public final int getOpponentHealth()
        Returns the opponent's health points. The health is a value from 0 (dead) to 5 (maximum).
        Returns:
        the opponent's health

      • getOpponentX

        public final int getOpponentX()
        Returns the opponent's x-position. The x-position is a value from 0 (left-most) to getMapWidth()-1 (right-most).
        Returns:
        the opponent's x-position

      • getOpponentY

        public final int getOpponentY()
        Returns the opponent's y-position. The y-position is a value from 0 (top) to getMapHeight()-1 (bottom).
        Returns:
        the opponent's y-position

      • getPlayerHealth

        public final int getPlayerHealth()
        Returns the player's health points. The health is a value from 0 (dead) to 5 (maximum).
        Returns:
        the player's health

      • getPlayerMaxHealth

        public final int getPlayerMaxHealth()
        Returns the maximum health possible for a Player entity as defined by Player.HEALTH_MAX.
        Returns:
        maximum player health

      • getPlayerX

        public final int getPlayerX()
        Returns the player's x-position. The x-position is a value from 0 (left-most) to getMapWidth()-1 (right-most).
        Returns:
        the player's x-position

      • getPlayerY

        public final int getPlayerY()
        Returns the player's y-position. The y-position is a value from 0 (top) to getMapHeight()-1 (bottom).
        Returns:
        the player's y-position

      • isEmpty

        public final boolean isEmpty(int x,
                             int y)
                      throws OutOfBoundsException
        Checks if the coordinate specified contains no entities (GameState.EntityType.Empty).

        The position is zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (getMapWidth()-1, getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

        Parameters:
        x - - zero-based x-position
        y - - zero-based y-position
        Returns:
        true if empty, false otherwise
        Throws:
        OutOfBoundsException - when the position is out of bounds

      • isWall

        public final boolean isWall(int x,
                            int y)
                     throws OutOfBoundsException
        Checks if the coordinate specified contains a wall (GameState.EntityType.Wall).

        The position is zero-based, meaning the the minimum coordinate is (0, 0) (top-left) and the maximum coordinate is (getMapWidth()-1, getMapHeight()-1) (bottom-right).

      • getStormSize

        public final int getStormSize()
        Returns the current storm size. It is the number of diagonal blocks from the map's edge.
        Returns:
        the storm size

      • getStormMaxSize

        public final int getStormMaxSize()
        Returns the maximum size the storm will get to. It is the number of diagonal blocks from the map's edge.
        Returns:
        the maximum storm size

      • getRoundsTillNextStormAdvance

        public final int getRoundsTillNextStormAdvance()
        Returns the number of rounds before the next storm advancement.
        Returns:
        number of rounds
        See Also:
        getRound()

      • getRound

        public final int getRound()
        Returns the current round.
        Returns:
        current round

      • canPlaceMine

        public final boolean canPlaceMine()
        Returns true if the player can place a mine, false otherwise. Note that the player can only place 1 mine per 10 rounds.
        Returns:
        true if can place mine, false otherwise

      • getCurrentMineCooldown

        public final int getCurrentMineCooldown()
        Returns the amount of rounds before the player can place a mine. Note that the player can only place 1 mine per 10 rounds.
        Returns:
        amount of rounds before can place a mine
